title: Commission Regulation (EC) No 1438/97 of 23 July 1997 derogating, for Spain, from the marketing standards applicable to melons
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EC) No 1438/97 of 23 July 1997 derogating, for Spain, from the marketing standards applicable to melons
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. Notwithstanding Annex I to Regulation (EC) No 1093/97, melons with an elongated shape produced in Spain may be sold loose in the region of production by the retail trade.
2. For the purposes of paragraph 1, the document or, where appropriate, the notice referred to in Article 5 (2) of Regulation (EC) No 2200/96, accompanying each consignment must bear, in addition to the other information required, the following indication: 'For sale by the retail trade in . . . (region of production) only`.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 23 July 1997.
For the Commission
Franz FISCHLER
Member of the Commission
